definition: water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes

sentences.english: Her cheeks were bedewed with tears.
sentences.chinese: 她的雙頰被淚水沾溼了。

sentences.english: This week is for mourning. Tears have a therapeutic power.
sentences.chinese: 這是哀痛的一週，淚水可以治療悲傷。

sentences.english: Deborah shook her head, tears in her own eyes.
sentences.chinese: 德博拉搖搖頭，眼裏滿是淚水。

sentences.english: The youngster immediately fell silent as tears welled up in his big blue eyes.
sentences.chinese: 小男孩馬上不吭聲了，藍色的大眼睛裏湧滿了淚水。

sentences.english: Miss the emotion that I shed tears of missing.
sentences.chinese: 懷念的情思使我流下思念的淚水。

sentences.english: If Lin Jun drags along to have Yi lotus Nuo, porsche p5000 adidas, wipes out sad tears for her.
sentences.chinese: 林君如拖起了伊蓮娜，爲她拭去傷心的淚水。

sentences.english: His eyes filled with tears as he looked lovingly at her.
sentences.chinese: 他飽含深情地望着她時，眼裏充滿了淚水。

sentences.english: Her tears washed away the paint from her face.
sentences.chinese: 淚水把她臉上的脂粉都沖掉了。

sentences.english: Zhang Jingjing has been the face of silent tears fall quietly.
sentences.chinese: 張晶晶臉上無聲的淚水已悄然滑落。

sentences.english: Swiftly fly the years, one season following another . Laden with happiness and tear .
sentences.chinese: 日月如梭，季節變換，滿載着歡樂和淚水。

sentences.english: Tears of happiness poured down Sussan's cheeks.
sentences.chinese: 幸福的淚水滑下蘇珊的臉頰。

sentences.english: By this time Felice's tears began to blind her.
sentences.chinese: 這時候淚水開始矇住了佛艾麗絲的眼睛。

sentences.english: Every time I watched this movie, my tears welled up in my eyes.
sentences.chinese: 在看《剪刀手愛德華》時，淚水模糊了我的視線。

sentences.english: Mrs. Thompson, with tears in her eyes, whispered back.
sentences.chinese: 湯普生太太，她眼中的淚水，低聲說回來。

sentences.english: The dainties of the great are the tears of the poor.
sentences.chinese: 富人口中的美味是窮人眼中的淚水。

definition: helpless/without choice/for lack of better option/grudgingly/willy-nilly/nolens volens/abbr. for 無可奈何|无可奈何[wu2 ke3 nai4 he2]
to recount/to tell of/to relate/(fig.) (of a thing) to stand as testament to (some past history)
